channel.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
channel.description:
Passives Head Count: Will know who the prince jails each night Royal Blood: (Same)
Day Spread Rumors: Talk to the unseen/cult tonight [2 uses] Silence [2 day cool down]: Any BD (Not including king) who whispers the prince will not be able to use night abilities tonight [2 uses]
Night Search: Determine if your target is a killer class [infinite uses] Mutiny: If your target is the prince, kill them, bypasses death immunity and prevention (not healing). Not usable until night 3. [2 uses]
Goal: Survive to see the prince die.
Feel free to leave suggestions! And yes, I know this is basically the inquisitor for the prince, I'm very original.

item.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
No. Hardcounters shouldn’t even exist, they’re too easy to win as. I do agree that prince needs a nerf though, it shouldn’t have redirection and occupation immunity. Everything needs counterplay

Read full topic

item.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
Maybe he can make it guaranteed?

Tbh I’d rather remove occupation/target change for prince and make him have either night immunity once or night immunity on night 1

I would choose the second option honestly

Read full topic

item.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Problem with that is that this class isn’t guarenteed.

item.description:
Maybe buff prince as well and give him one time night immunity? Idk

item.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Okay imagine this

People say inquistor is easy to win as?

Atleast sorc can only die to a inquistor ot BD

Prince dies N1 and he did nothing.

This encourages prince to out themselves more to

Read full topic

item.title: The Duke (Neutral Social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
True. But none of those rules are proof that a class idea is bad. They are just guidelines that tend to produce bad results.

Read full topic

item.description:
No class deserves a counter
